titleStmt.title: A most wonderful and true relation of one Mr. Philips, who was stung to death by a serpent; in Stocks-Market on Saturday last, and was afterwards brought to life again and perfectly cured by a wonderful medicine, in half an hours time, and is in perfect health. With account what that medicine was, and who prepared it.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and sold by J. Bradford in Little Britain,

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: stained with some loss of text.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
